```{r}
#installing packages
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
```


```{r}
meteor_data <- read.csv(here::here("data", "ntl20_v6.csv"))
ice_cover_data <- read.csv(here::here("data", "ntl33_v7.csv"))
```

```{r}
#removing the NAs
ice_cover_data <- na.omit(ice_cover_data)
#ice_madison_clean
```
```{r}
#creating a  subset of only the lake id of ME lake
ice_madison_me <- ice_cover_data %>% 
  filter(lakeid == "ME")

#ploting the data in a boxplot
ggplot(ice_madison_me, aes(x = lakeid, y = ice_duration)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.5, color = "steelblue") +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, fill = NA, color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Ice Cover Duration by Lake",
    x = "Lake",
    y = "Ice Duration (days)"
  )
```

```{r}
#finding the ice duration in the madison lake area
ice_madison <- ice_madison_me %>%
  filter(lakeid == "ME")

ice_madison_mean
```
```{r}
#creating a boxplot of the ice duration based on location.
ggplot(ice_madison, aes(x = lakeid, y = ice_duration)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.5, color = "steelblue") +
  #removing NA values
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, fill = NA, color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Ice Cover Duration by Lake",
    x = "Lake",
    y = "Ice Duration (days)"
  )
```

```{r}
#mean of the ice cover
mean_ice_by_year <- ice_madison %>%
  group_by(year4) %>%
  summarise(mean_ice_duration = mean(ice_duration, na.rm = TRUE),
            .groups = "drop")

mean_ice_by_year

```

```{r}
#creating a scatterplot based on years and mean ice duration
ggplot(mean_ice_by_year, aes(x = year4, y = mean_ice_duration)) +
  geom_line(color = "darkblue") +
  geom_point(color = "darkblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Mean Ice Cover Duration by Year – Madison Lake Area",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Mean Ice Duration (days)"
  )
```

```{r}
data.class(meteor_data$month)
```




```{r}
#find the mean air temp 
meteor_madison <- meteor_data %>%
  #mutate(month = month(date)) %>%
  filter(month %in% c(12, 1, 2))

mean_temp_by_year <- meteor_madison %>%
  group_by(year4) %>%
  summarise(mean_winter_temp = mean(ave_air_temp_adjusted, na.rm = TRUE),
            .groups = "drop")


meteor_madison
```



```{r}
ggplot(mean_temp_by_year, aes(x = year4, y = mean_winter_temp)) +
  geom_line(color = "red") +
  geom_point(color = "red") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Mean Winter Air Temperature by Year – Madison Lake Area",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Mean Temp (°C)"
  )

```

```{r}
# Join mean temp to mean ice duration
ice_temp_joined <- mean_ice_by_year %>%
  inner_join(mean_temp_by_year, by = "year4")

# Scatterplot
ggplot(ice_temp_joined, aes(x = mean_winter_temp, y = mean_ice_duration)) +
  geom_point(color = "lightblue", alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Mean Winter Temp vs. Mean Ice Duration",
    x = "Mean Winter Temp (°C)",
    y = "Mean Ice Duration (days)"
  )
```
# Based on this graph, it shows that over the years, both mean winter temperatures and duration has has decreased. In other words, the length of duration has decrerased but temperatures have intensified.

```{r}
ice_since_1970 <- ice_madison %>%
  filter(year4 >= 1970) %>%
  mutate(ice_off_date = ymd(ice_off),
         ice_off_date = yday(ice_off_date))

ggplot(ice_since_1970, aes(x = year4, y = ice_off_date)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.6, color = "darkgreen") +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Ice-Off Day of Year (1970–present)",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Day of Year (Ice-Off)"
  )

# Observed trend: Thaw dates have shifted earlier in the calendar year over time.
```
